data.title: Is it a possible IP?
data.statement:
You have a [[N]] IP(IPV4) and you need to check if they can be used by our local machines. An IP address that can be used are called here <<possible IP>>

An IPV4 IP address is made up of decimal numbers separated by "." . It is used to define a device on a local network. However, it must respect a protocol:
It must contain 4 decimal numbers, each of which can be contained in 8 bits of data (0 to 255).
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read ips:string(256)
write list of possible Ip
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A integer [[N]] representing the number of IP to check
<<Line 2:>> [[N]] [[ip]] space-separated string containing IP addresses
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> Space-separated string of <<possible IP>> in the same order as they appear in input . If there is no <<possible IP>> {{None}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have a N IP(IPV4) and you need to check if they can be used by our local machines. An IP address that can be used are called here possible IP

An IPV4 IP address is made up of decimal numbers separated by "." . It is used to define a device on a local network. However, it must respect a protocol:
It must contain 4 decimal numbers, each of which can be contained in 8 bits of data (0 to 255).
Input
Line 1: A integer N representing the number of IP to check
Line 2: N ip space-separated string containing IP addresses
Output
Line 1: Space-separated string of possible IP in the same order as they appear in input . If there is no possible IP None.
Constraints
0<N<=10
Example
Input
2
192.168.0.125 40.5.65.256
Output
192.168.0.125
